item.title: Malagasy
item.description: Overview despite the island being close to Africa, the vocabulary of the Malagasy language largely originated from one that was spoken along the Barito River valley of southeast Borneo. Some 90% of Malagasy vocabulary is from the language of the Ma’anyan, an indigenous group of roughly 70,000 people who live in remote inland areas of southeastern Borneo. Less than 10% of the vocabulary of the Malagasy language is from African languages (mainly Sabaki, a branch of Bantu).

item.title: Phillipines
item.description: Hindu past Kingdoms Prior to its Christianization and Islamization, Philippines used to have quite many Indianized kingdoms. PB These included -Tondo -Butuan -Cebu -Madyas “The Rajahante of Cebu was interesting because it was found by Sri Lumay who claimed Chola descent. When the Cholas invaded Sriwijaya, a branch of Cholas settled there are married native Malay wives. One of the princes went to Philippines to establish his own kingdom.” Culture Some places in Philippines still have names of Sanskrit etymology (eg: visaya-s, manila); local language - esp religious language borrows from deva dharma.
